fields.name: x
fields.description: x-position of the object

fields.name: y
fields.description: y-position (the baseline of the text)

fields.name: z
fields.description: z-position (used only in 3d)

fields.name: defaults.scaleX
fields.description: The default x-scale for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.scaleY
fields.description: The default y-scale for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.scaleZ
fields.description: The default z-scale for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.fill
fields.description: The default fill for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.rotateX
fields.description: The default x-rotation for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.rotateY
fields.description: The default y-rotation for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.rotateZ
fields.description: The default z-rotation for all newly created RiTexts

fields.name: defaults.alignment
fields.description: The default alignment for all newly created RiTexts

returns.desc: Either LEFT, CENTER, or RIGHT (RiText.LEFT, RiText.CENTER, or RiText.RIGHT)

fields.name: defaults.motionType
fields.description: The default motionType for all newly created RiTexts

returns.desc: One of LINEAR, EASE_IN, EASE_OUT, EASE_IN_OUT, EASE_IN_OUT_CUBIC, EASE_IN_CUBIC, EASE_OUT_CUBIC, EASE_IN_OUT_QUARTIC, EASE_IN_QUARTIC, EASE_OUT_QUARTIC, EASE_IN_OUT_SINE, EASE_IN_SINE, EASE_OUT_SINE, EASE_IN_OUT_EXPO, EASE_IN_EXPO, or EASE_OUT_EXPO

fields.name: features
fields.description: Returns the current set of features for the object, including phonemes, syllables, stresses, etc.

returns.desc: Map (in Java), Object with key-value pairs (in JS)

fields.name: analyze
fields.description: Computes a set of features for the RiText, including phonemes, syllables, stresses, etc. To access any of these, use myRiText.get(featureName)

fields.name: charAt
fields.description: Returns the character at the given 'index', or an empty string if none is found

fields.name: concat
fields.description: Concatenates the text from another RiText at the end of this one

fields.name: endsWith
fields.description: Tests if this String ends with the specified suffix

returns.desc: true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a suffix of the character sequence represented by this object; false otherwise

fields.name: equals
fields.description:
Compares this RiText to the specified object.
The result is true if and only if the argument is not null and is a String or RiText object that represents the same sequence of characters as this object.

parameters.desc: String or RiText object to compare this RiText against

returns.desc: true if the RiText are equal; false otherwise.

fields.name: equalsIgnoreCase
fields.description: Compares this RiText to another RiText, ignoring case considerations

parameters.desc: String or RiText object to compare this RiText against

returns.desc: true if the argument is not null and the Strings are equal, ignoring case; false otherwise

fields.name: indexOf
fields.description: Returns the index within this string of the first occurrence of the specified character

parameters.desc: searchstring (required) or character to search for
(Optional) The start position in the String to start the search. If omitted, the search starts from position 0

returns.desc: the first index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found

fields.name: insertWord
fields.description: Inserts 'newWord' at 'wordIdx' and shifts each subsequent word accordingly.

fields.name: lastIndexOf
fields.description: Returns the index within this String of the last occurrence of the specified character

parameters.desc: searchstring (Required) or character to search for
(Optional) The start position in the String to start the search. If omitted, the search starts from position 0

returns.desc: the last index of the matching pattern or -1 if none are found

fields.name: length
fields.description: Returns the length of this String

fields.name: pos
fields.description: Returns an array of part-of-speech tags (from the PENN tag set), one per word, using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags(), with tags from the PENN tag set

returns.desc: strings of pos, one per word

fields.name: posAt
fields.description: Returns the part-of-speech tag (from the PENN tag set) for the word at 'index', using RiTa.tokenize() and RiTa.getPosTags(), with tags from the PENN tag set

fields.name: removeChar
fields.description: Removes the character at the specified index

fields.name: replaceChar
fields.description:
Replaces the character at 'idx' with 'replaceWith'.
If the specified 'idx' is less than zero, or beyond the length of the current text, there will be no effect

fields.name: match
fields.description: Searches for a match between a substring (or regular expression) and the contained string, and returns all matches. Regular expressions will be used if the 1st argument is a regular expression, otherwise only generic string-matching is used (special regex characaters are escaped)

returns.desc: string array of matches or empty array if none are found

fields.name: replaceFirst
fields.description: Replaces the first instance of 'substitution' with 'replacement'. Regular expressions (non-global) will be used only if the 1st argument is a regular expression, otherwise only generic string-matching is used (special regex characaters are escaped)

fields.name: replaceAll
fields.description: Replaces each occurrence of 'substitution' with 'replacement'. Regular expressions will be used if the 1st argument is a regular expression, otherwise only generic string-matching is used (special regex characaters are escaped)

fields.name: replaceWord
fields.description: Replaces the word at 'wordIdx' with 'newWord'

fields.name: slice
fields.description: Extracts a part of a String from this RiText

parameters.desc: (Required) The index where to begin the extraction. First character is at index 0
(Optional) Where to end the extraction. If omitted, slice() selects all characters from the begin position to the end of the String

fields.name: startsWith
fields.description: Tests if this String starts with the specified prefix

returns.desc:
true if the character sequence represented by the argument is a prefix of the character sequence represented by this String; false otherwise.
Note also that true will be returned if the argument is an empty String or is equal to this RiText object as determined by the equals() method.

fields.name: substring
fields.description: Extracts the characters from a String, between two specified indices, and sets the current text to be that String.

parameters.desc: The index where to start the extraction. First character is at index 0
(optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the String

fields.name: substr
fields.description: Extracts the characters from this objects contained String, beginning at 'start' and continuing through the specified number of characters, and sets the current text to be that String. (from Javascript String)

parameters.desc: The index where to start the extraction. First character is at index 0
(optional) The index where to stop the extraction. If omitted, it extracts the rest of the String

fields.name: text
fields.description: Gets/sets the text contained by this object

returns.desc: the contained text (for sets) or this RiText (for gets)

fields.name: toLowerCase
fields.description: Converts all of the characters in this RiText to lower case

fields.name: toUpperCase
fields.description: Converts all of the characters in this RiText to upper case

fields.name: trim
fields.description: Returns a copy of the String, with leading and trailing whitespace omitted.

fields.name: wordAt
fields.description: Returns the word at 'index', according to RiTa.tokenize

fields.name: wordCount
fields.description: Returns the number of words in the object, according to RiTa.tokenize().

fields.name: words
fields.description: Returns the array of words in the object, via a call to RiTa.tokenize

fields.name: alpha
fields.description: Set/gets the alpha (transparency) for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for set) or the current alpha value (for get)

fields.name: boundingStroke
fields.description: Set/gets the boundingStroke color for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current color object (for gets)

fields.name: boundingBox
fields.description: Returns the screen bounding box for the current text

fields.name: center
fields.description: Returns the center point of the RiText as derived from its bounding box

fields.name: charOffset
fields.description: Returns the pixel x-offset for the character at 'charIdx'

fields.name: copy
fields.description: Creates and returns a field-for-field copy of this RiText

fields.name: fill
fields.description: Set/gets the fill color for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current color object (for gets)

fields.name: boundingStrokeWeight
fields.description: Set/gets the boundingStrokeWeight for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current stroke-weight (for gets)

fields.name: contains
fields.description: Returns true if the bounding box for this RiText contains the point mx/my

fields.name: distanceTo
fields.description: Returns the distance between the center points of this object and another RiText, or between this object's center and a point (x,y)

parameters.desc: the other RiText or the X-position of the point

returns.desc: the distance from this RiText's center point

fields.name: draw
fields.description: Draws the object to the screen

fields.name: font
fields.description: Set/gets the font for this RiText

parameters.desc: (optional) generally a PFont containing the font data OR
font containing the font name AND

returns.desc: this RiText (set) or the current font (get)

fields.name: align
fields.description: Sets/gets the alignment.

parameters.desc: (optional) the alignment: RiTa.LEFT (default), RiTa.CENTER, or RiTa.RIGHT

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current alignment (for gets)

fields.name: fontSize
fields.description: Sets/gets the size of the current font. Note: this method only effects only scaleX/Y, not the font's internal properties

returns.desc: either this RiText (for set) or the current font size (for get)

fields.name: motionType
fields.description:
Sets/gets the animation motionType for this RiText
according to one of the following functions:
  • RiText.LINEAR
  • RiText.EASE_IN
  • RiText.EASE_OUT
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT
  • RiText.EASE_IN_EXPO
  • RiText.EASE_OUT_EXPO
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_EXPO
  • RiText.EASE_IN_SINE
  • RiText.EASE_OUT_SINE
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_SINE
  • RiText.EASE_IN_CUBIC
  • RiText.EASE_OUT_CUBIC
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_CUBIC
  • RiText.EASE_IN_QUARTIC
  • RiText.EASE_OUT_QUARTIC
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_QUARTIC
  • RiText.EASE_IN_QUINTIC
  • RiText.EASE_OUT_QUINTIC
  • RiText.EASE_IN_OUT_QUINTIC
  • RiText.BACK_IN
  • RiText.BACK_OUT
  • RiText.BACK_IN_OUT
  • RiText.BOUNCE_IN
  • RiText.BOUNCE_OUT
  • RiText.BOUNCE_IN_OUT
  • RiText.CIRCULAR_IN
  • RiText.CIRCULAR_OUT
  • RiText.CIRCULAR_IN_OUT
  • RiText.ELASTIC_IN
  • RiText.ELASTIC_OUT
  • RiText.ELASTIC_IN_OUT

parameters.desc: (optional) motionType, One of LINEAR, EASE_IN, EASE_OUT, EASE_IN_OUT, EASE_IN_OUT_CUBIC, EASE_IN_CUBIC, EASE_OUT_CUBIC, EASE_IN_OUT_QUARTIC, EASE_IN_QUARTIC, EASE_OUT_QUARTIC, EASE_IN_OUT_SINE, EASE_IN_SINE, EASE_OUT_SINE, EASE_IN_OUT_EXPO, EASE_IN_EXPO, or EASE_OUT_EXPO

fields.name: position
fields.description: Set/gets the font for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or object {x, y} (for gets)

fields.name: rotate
fields.description: Sets/gets the 2d rotation for this RiText

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current degree of rotation (for gets)

fields.name: scale
fields.description: Sets/gets the scale factor for this RiText (takes 0-2 arguments)

returns.desc: either this RiText (for sets) or the current scales (for gets)

fields.name: showBounds
fields.description: Set/gets the bounding box visibility for this RiText

returns.desc: this RiText (set) or the current boolean value (get)

fields.name: splitLetters
fields.description: Splits the object into an array of RiTexts, one per letter, maintaining the x and y position of each. Note: In most cases the original RiText should be disposed manually to avoid text a doubling effect (via RiText.dispose(originalRiText)).

fields.name: splitWords
fields.description: Splits the current object into an array of RiTexts, one per word, maintaining the x and y position of each. Note: In most cases the original RiText should be disposed manually to avoid text a doubling effect (via RiText.dispose(originalRiText)).

fields.name: textHeight
fields.description: Returns the current height of the text (derived from the bounding box)

returns.desc: the current height of the text

fields.name: textAscent
fields.description: Returns the ascent of the current font

returns.desc: the ascent of the current font

fields.name: textDescent
fields.description: Returns the descent of the current font

returns.desc: the descent of the current font

fields.name: textWidth
fields.description: Returns the current width of the text (derived from the bounding box)

fields.name: isVisible
fields.description: Returns false if the alpha value of this object is <= 0, else true

returns.desc: false if the alpha value of this object is <= 0

fields.name: wordOffset
fields.description: Returns the pixel x-offset for the word at 'wordIdx'

fields.name: fadeIn
fields.description:
Fades in current text over seconds starting at startTime.
Interpolates from the current color {r,g,b,a} to {r,g,b,255}.

parameters.desc: optional callback for when the action has completed (by default, uses onRiTaEvent(re))

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: fadeOut
fields.description:
Fades out current text over seconds starting at startTime.
Interpolates from the current color {r,g,b,a} to {r,g,b,255}.
fields.syntax:
rt.fadeOut(seconds)
fadeOut(seconds, delay);
rt.fadeOut(seconds, delay, callback);
rt.fadeOut(seconds, delay, callback, destroyOnComplete);

parameters.desc: (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start  (seconds)
the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))
(optional, default=false), destroys the object when the behavior completes

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: moveTo
fields.description:
Move to new x,y position over 'seconds'

Note: uses the current motionType for this object, starting at 'delay' seconds in the future

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: colorTo
fields.description: Transitions to 'color' (rgba) over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
fields.syntax:
rt.colorTo(colors)
rt.colorTo(colorArr, seconds);
rt.colorTo(colorArr, seconds, delay);
rt.colorTo(colorArr, seconds, delay, callback);

parameters.desc: seconds (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start
callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: rotateTo
fields.description: Rotates to 'radians' over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
fields.syntax:
rt.rotateTo(angleInRadians)
rt.rotateTo(angleInRadians, seconds);
rt.rotateTo(angleInRadians, seconds, delay);
rt.rotateTo(angleInRadians, seconds, delay, callback);

parameters.desc: seconds (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start
callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: scaleTo
fields.description: Scales to 'theScale' over 'seconds' starting at 'delay' seconds in the future
fields.syntax:
rt.scaleTo(theScale)
rt.scaleTo(theScale, seconds);
rt.scaleTo(theScale, seconds, delay);
rt.scaleTo(theScale, seconds, delay, callback);

parameters.desc: seconds (optional, default=0),  # of seconds in the future that the fade will start
callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: stopBehavior
fields.description: Removes the specified text behavior for the object

fields.name: stopBehaviors
fields.description: Removes all text behaviors for the object

fields.name: textTo
fields.description: Fades out the current text and fades in the newText over seconds
fields.syntax:
rt.textTo(newText)
rt.textTo(newText, seconds);
rt.textTo(newText, seconds, startTime);
textTo(newText, seconds, endAlpha, function callback);

parameters.desc: (optional, default=255), the alpha to end on
callback the callback to be invoked when the behavior has completed (optional: default=onRiTaEvent(e))

returns.desc: the unique id for this behavior

fields.name: RiText.createLetters
fields.description: Creates an array of RiTexts, laid out in lines within the bounding rectange(x,y,w,h), one RiText per letter, with spacing determined by the specified font and leading
fields.syntax: RiText.createLetters(pApplet, text, x, y, w, h, font, leading);

parameters.desc: the sketch itself or 'this' (optional in JavaScript)
the text to layout (if an array, each array element will be a line in the layout)
width of layout rect (optional, defaults to right-most edge of sketch)
height of layout rect (optional, defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)
the font to use (generally a PFont) for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.font)
the leading to use for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.leading)

fields.name: RiText.createWords
fields.description: Creates an array of RiTexts ,laid out in lines within the bounding rectange(x,y,w,h), one RiText per word, with spacing determined by the specified font and leading
fields.syntax: RiText.createWords(pApplet, text, x, y, w, h, font, leading);

parameters.desc: the sketch itself or 'this' (optional in JavaScript)
the text to layout (if an array, each array element will be a line in the layout)
width of layout rect (optional, defaults to right-most edge of sketch)
height of layout rect (optional, defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)
the font to use (generally a PFont) for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.font)
the leading to use for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.leading)

fields.name: RiText.createLines
fields.description: Creates an array of RiTexts ,laid out in lines within the bounding rectange(x,y,w,h), one RiText per line, with spacing determined by the specified font and leading
fields.syntax: RiText.createLines(pApplet, text, x, y, w, h, font, leading);

parameters.desc: the sketch itself or 'this' (optional in JavaScript)
the text to layout (if an array, each array element will be a line in the layout)
width of layout rect (optional, defaults to right-most edge of sketch)
height of layout rect (optional, defaults to Number.MAX_VALUE)
the font to use (generally a PFont) for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.font)
the leading to use for the layout (optional, defaults to RiText.defaults.leading)

fields.name: RiText.drawAll
fields.description: A convenience method to draw all existing RiText objects (with no argument) or an array of RiText objects (if supplied as an argument)

parameters.desc: draws only the array if supplied (optional)

fields.name: RiText.dispose
fields.description: Deletes the RiText (or RiText[])  and all its associated resources.

fields.name: RiText.disposeAll
fields.description: Deletes all currently existing RiTexts.

fields.name: RiText.defaultFill
fields.description: Convenience method to set/get the default fill color

parameters.desc: red component or grey value or an array of values

fields.name: RiText.defaultFont
fields.description: Convenience method to set/get the default font

parameters.desc: font (optional, for 'sets' only), generally a PFont

returns.desc: either null (for 'sets') or the current default font (for 'gets')

fields.name: RiText.defaultFontSize
fields.description: Convenience method to set/get the default font size

returns.desc: either null (for 'sets') or the current default font size (for 'gets')

fields.name: RiText.randomColor
fields.description: Returns a random color in which the 3 values for rgb (or rgba if 'includeAlpha' is true), are between min and max

fields.name: RiText.picked
fields.description:
Returns all RiTexts that contain the point x,y or null if none do.

Note: this will return an array even if only one item is picked, therefore, you should generally use it as example

returns.desc: one or more RiTexts containing the point, or an empty array if none do.

fields.name: RiText.timer
fields.description: Starts a timer that calls 'onRiTaEvent()', or the specified callback (in JS), every 'period' seconds

parameters.desc: the parent object in which to find (optional in JS)

callback function to be called every 'period' seconds
the function name String (in Java) or the function itself (in JS)

returns.desc: the unique id for the timer

fields.note: The 'parent' object is optional in JS, and the optional callback is a function, rather than a String name

fields.name: RiText.stopTimer
fields.description: Stops a timer according to its unique id

parameters.desc: the unique id for the timer

fields.name: RiText.pauseTimer
fields.description: Pauses a timer according to its unique id (and assigns a new unique id)

parameters.desc: the unique id for the timer

returns.desc: the new unique id for the timer

fields.name: RiText.random
fields.description: Returns a random number between 'min' (default 0) and 'max'
